Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. character.name: Oldna Poseidal
character.description:
Originally from the planet Gastogal, Oldna Poseidal is the main antagonist of the show, having taken over all 5 planets of the Pentagona system. The mysterious Poseidal rarely appears in public and when so often appears via hologram. Through the power of bio-relation she has eternal youth and has the ability to control others, such as Quwasan Olibee.
In reality, "Poseidal" is Mian Ku Ha Attsher, a former Temple Knight of the true Poseidal, who hides under the name Amandara Kamandara. Having fallen in love with him, she agreed to take his place but fell completely under his control and largely became a puppet of his, so much so that she believed she really was Poseidal. To keep up the facade she wears a bizarre costume, including makeup and contact lenses. As the years passed, Poseidal`s bio-relation weakened and Mian was able to think more for herself, particularly after the involvement of Full Flat. When Poseidal returns to Gastogal to return to his true role, she is able to deactive the bio-relation system that retains their eternal youth and she immediately ages to death.

character.name: Gaw Ha Leccee
character.description: Gaw Ha Leccee is a trainee for the Poseidal Military`s Elite 13 unit, stationed on the planet Koam. When Daba and the others steal a shuttle to head to the planet Mizun, Leccee goes on board in an attempt to get it back. After landing on Mizun she follows Daba and his friends, eventually deciding to defect from the military to join them due to falling in love with Daba. Leccee is constantly in arguments with Amu over him. She is a skilled Heavy Metal pilot. Eventually Leccee becomes frustrated with the rebel movement and leaves them, joining up with Amandara Kamandara`s group and acting as captain for the space shuttle Whale. She continues to assist Daba and the others throughout the rest of the conflict.

character.name: Gablae Gavlet
character.description:
An ambitious man from Koam who seeks to join the Poseidal military. Gavlet encounters Daba, Amu, Kyao and Lilith in the woods and a feud starts between them when he steals their food and attacks Lilith, considering her to be a bad omen. Through a recommendation from Amandara Kamandara he joins the Poseidal military and pursues Daba and the others from planet to planet, eventually being promoted to tactical adviser of the shuttle Slender Skala, and later to the Elite 13 under Giwaza Lowau. Gavlet pilots a number of different Heavy Metals but is constantly defeated in battle by Daba.
Gavlet eventually defects to the rebel`s side after falling in love with Daba`s sister, Quwasan Olibee.

character.name: Daba Myroad
character.description:
Main character and pilot of the L-Gaim. Daba is a strong pilot and leader. Originally from the planet Mizun, he travels across the Pentagona Worlds, initially to return a cash card to the mysterious Amandara Kamandara, but also leads rebel groups in an attempt to defeat Oldna Poseidal.
In reality Daba is prince of the Yaman Clan, the civilization that ruled Mizun and was overthrown by Poseidal`s conquest. Daba, whose real name is Kamon Myroad seeks to overthrow Poseidal in order to attain justice for the Yaman Clan as well as his father.

character.name: Fanneria Amu
character.description: An aspiring actress who joins up with a group of bandits on the planet Koam. When Amu meets Daba and Kyao, in an attempt to steal the L-Gaim, she falls in love with Daba and leaves the bandits to join them. She constantly fights with Leccee over Daba`s affections, despite the fact that he only rarely shows feelings for her. Amu doesn`t have much talent, but grows into a rebel leader over the course of the series; captaining the shuttle Turner and eventually becoming the pilot of the L-Gaim once the L-Gaim Mark II is developed.

character.name: Mirao Kyao
character.description: Best friend of Daba from the planet Koam. Kyao is a skilled mechanic and pilot of the L-Gaim`s support vehicle, The Works. He initially has a goal of joining the Poseidal military, but multiple attempts end in failure and he remains a loyal ally of Daba`s.

character.name: Lilith Fau
character.description: Lilith is the last remaining fairy in the Pentagona world. Daba finds Lilith in the possession of a man in the city of Prearmo on Koam and purchases her from him. Lilith`s short stature prevents her from piloting a Heavy Metal but she frequently accompanies Daba when he is piloting and helps with chores such as cooking. Later in the series she helps prevent a nuclear explosion at the asteroid base Palarta Star during which she is seriously injured for several episodes.

character.name: Miyama Lilin
character.description:
The leader of a group of bandits that attempts to steal the L-Gaim on Koam. Despite getting her arm cut off by Daba she tries multiple times to steal it from him.
Lilin is killed by Hashamoja, one of her own men after she had humiliated him in front of the other bandits. Later in the series her daughter appears on Trydetol and attempts to murder Daba to get revenge.

character.name: Hassha Mossha
character.description: A selfish member of Lilin`s group of bandits. He and Amu are reunited when she is provided with the shuttle Turner, but he betrays our heroes multiple times and permanently teams up with Gavlet on the Slender Skala.
